channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Ross North sales and marketing manager Shane Casserly recalled an instance just days after the federal grant was announced where a developer sold a parcel of land from underneath a client 45 minutes before they were due to view the block.
item.title: WA builder raises concerns of price gouging just days after state and federal new home grants

item.dc:creator: Gary Adshead
item.description: More than 30 per cent of WA tourism businesses say they will go under unless the Premier’s hard border with the eastern states is lifted.
item.title: Trouble in paradise: WA businesses to vanish if Premier Mark McGowan doesn't lift hard borders

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 408,000 and there are more than 7.1 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 7.1 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: The "recession" label cements the pain that many voters are already feeling from the economy and will feed into their choice for who they trust to get it back on track.
item.title: 'Recession president' is a title Trump will struggle to shake off

item.description: A Brazilian Supreme Court judge has ordered the government of President Jair Bolsonaro to publish full COVID-19 data, including the cumulative death toll.
item.title: Bolsonaro government ordered to publish Brazil's full COVID-19 toll

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for sharp fall as Wall Street retreats

item.description: World No.1 Novak Djokovic says most players are "quite negative" about taking part in a US Open tournament set to be besieged by coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: Djokovic may skip US Open to focus on French Open preparations

item.description: The social media platform's efforts to tackle conspiracy theories are making little headway as users spam the system.
item.title: Twitter's plan to challenge 5G conspiracy theories backfires

item.description: Sixteen-Test prop Ellis Genge said the incident happened after a Test on a three-match tour in 2018, but did not specify which fixture.
item.title: 'A white man's game': England prop says he and Jones abused in SA

item.description: Legendary hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones didn't see this kind of sharemarket recovery coming so quickly.
item.title: 'Humble pie': Wall Street heavyweight confounded by share rally

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police and family members held serious concern for her welfare. The successful search followed another for a woman missing near a major south-east dam.
item.title: Woman missing from Brisbane's south found after four-day search

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police had been making unrelated inquiries when the discovery was made on Tuesday morning, shortly after restraining the man in the home.
item.title: Man, 43, accused of murdering elderly woman found in Cairns home

item.description: Airline losses are surging to unprecedented levels that are expected to be more than double those following the 2008 global economic slump.
item.title: Airline industry forecast to suffer record $121 billion loss

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The Reverend Al Sharpton acknowledged the grief felt by all families of those killed in police custody and condemned Donald Trump for "wickedness in high places".
item.title: 'We goin' fight on': George Floyd's funeral hears calls for justice

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Activists have drawn up a hit-list of 60 monuments that "celebrate slavery and racism" as London's mayor orders a new inquiry into statues and street names.
item.title: 'Topple the racists': statue wars escalate in Britain

item.description: Mohammed bin Salman needs to undo some of the damage he has himself wrought, and to avoid repeating his mistakes, to put Saudi Arabia back on track.
item.title: Saudi Arabia's crown prince needs to learn some difficult economic lessons

item.description: It was a dour day for much of Wall Street but the Nasdaq briefly rose above 10,000 for the first time, with Apple leading the way.
item.title: Nasdaq cracks 10,000 for the first time; ASX set for falls

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: A fall in teaching capacity and a declining reputation among employers hinders rankings.
item.title: Five Australian universities in world's top 50, but progress stalls

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: As a young cop of Greek heritage Nick Cecil was used to infiltrate gambling houses and became a key undercover operative to smash illegal bookmaking syndicates whilst masquerading as a busker.
item.title: Naked City podcast: Victoria's first undercover agent

item.dc:creator: Sam Downing
item.description: All you have to do is train more to strengthen your core, and eat less... sounds fun, right?
item.title: How to get six-pack abs and a solid reason why you might not want them

item.description: The US President tweeted without evidence that the confrontation with police officers may have been a "set up".
item.title: Trump pushes conspiracy theory about 75-year-old Buffalo protester

item.description: There was speculation about whether the President had in fact died of COVID-19, after his wife earlier contracted the virus.
item.title: Burundi's President Pierre Nkurunziza dies of heart attack, aged 56

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The NSW government was warned it was “almost certainly” going to fail key election commitments due to insufficient capital before the coronavirus pandemic hit.
item.title: State warned 'almost certain' risk of election commitment shortfall

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: While women reported a greater increase in drinking, men also reported drinking more during that period, a survey has found.
item.title: Women in child-caring roles reported drinking more during COVID-19 pandemic

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Shane Flanagan can't be a head coach until 2022, but he's St George Illawarra's best hope of winning this weekend as he faces Cronulla for the first time.
item.title: Why Dragons' best hopes of notching first win rest with Shane Flanagan

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: The demand on charities has skyrocketed at the same time as donations have gone through the floor.
item.title: Time to dig deep for those who haven't had a good crisis

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Fulltime bettor Chris Ryan says the code's new wagering taxes will ultimately harm its earning power, but Peter V'landys insists it won't turn major punters away.
item.title: 'Short-term cash grab': Pro punter warns NRL over gambling taxes

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: Despite opposition from the Deputy Premier the government intends to go ahead with a plan to remove some of the national park's famous brumbies.
item.title: Brumbies to be removed from Kosciuszko despite internal opposition

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Mental health nurses will be based at police stations to help officers deal with call outs to psychiatric emergencies.
item.title: Mental health nurses to be based at police stations

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The postal service has denied it is planning redundancies but Labor and the union movement have expressed alarm at recent changes.
item.title: Labor seeks to stop 'job cuts' at Australia Post

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Record numbers of lonely, distressed and depressed Australians have been calling Lifeline amid the protracted period of isolation and uncertainty under COVID-19 restrictions.
item.title: Suicide support service given funding boost amid deluge of calls

item.description: I once believed controversial figures should not get Orders of Australia. I was wrong.
item.title: Tony Abbott's views may be repellent to many but that's no reason not to honour him

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Wesfarmers, owner of Bunnings, Officeworks, Kmart and Target, hit the ball out of the park on sales during the COVID peak and in doing so created another retail category - discretionary essentials.
item.title: Right time, right products: How Wesfarmers accidentally pitched perfectly for pandemic

item.description: A proposal to counter systemic racism in the courts is in the NSW government's hands. It needs to give it the green light.
item.title: Premier needs to act on model to save black lives

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Growth-focused Charter Hall is busy boosting its key industrial portfolios as vacancy rates for industrial sheds start to creep higher.
item.title: Low vacancy and growth prospects boost industrial portfolios

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Facing the deadliest health crisis in a century and the worst economic challenge since the Great Depression, this is how Australia weathered the storm.
item.title: 'I see the full horror show': How Australia navigated the twin crises of COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Superannuation funds say the $3 trillion sector needs policy stability to take up Treasurer Josh Frydenberg's call for more retirement money to be invested in major infrastructure projects.
item.title: Super funds say policy stability key to more infrastructure investment

item.description: Nominees for Australian honours need to be closely judged against the criteria so they are not simply rewarded for doing a good job in their paid positions.
item.title: Just doing your job should not entitle you to honours

item.dc:creator: Chris Uhlmann
item.description: What is needed is the political will to confront the Original Sin of Australia's settlement.
item.title: National cabinet proved itself on COVID, now the nation's health depends on a more difficult task

item.description: In an event without precedent in the history of Federation, the proprietor and editor of a Bankstown newspaper were sentenced to jail by the House of Representatives.
item.title: From the Archives, 1955: Parliament sends two men to prison for contempt

item.description: Lockdown is keeping people physically safe from COVID, but at what cost?
item.title: We need a plan to unlock our nursing homes

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The parade was announced after two suggestions from the public were escalated to the lord mayor's office.
item.title: Internal documents reveal how City Hall scrambled to plan a firefighter parade

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Imagine being the literary editor of The Times when Siobhan McKenna’s debut novel lands on your desk. McKenna is, of course, News Corp’s group director.
item.title: Murdoch chief lieutenant pens debut novel

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Pity the poor literary editors within News Corp's stable of publications as they're faced with reviewing the new tome from Lachlan Murdoch’s chief lieutenant in Australia.
item.title: CBD Melbourne: Murdoch's chief lieutenant pens debut novel

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Earlier this year, our AFL experts put forward their 2020 season predictions and then coronavirus hit. So, they have revised their tips ahead of football's resumption on Thursday and explained why.
item.title: Revised ladder predictions: Our experts have their say

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: The State Coroner is investigating how Melbourne man Daniel "Danny" Richards died in police custody, with a witness saying one of the last things he said was: 'I can't breathe.'
item.title: 'I can't breathe': Danny Richards' family seek answers to custody death

item.description: The government's reaction to the mass protests in the CBD revealed that politics is starting to compromise the health response.
item.title: The bottom just fell out of social distancing in Victoria

item.description: As the restrictions on our movements ease and we tentatively emerge from our cocoons, I’m feeling some anxiety and trepidation about what kind of world we will return to.
item.title: A sad farewell to gentle era of lockdown

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Republican rising star Senator Rick Scott says Australia has a key role in helping the US face off against China: "We ought to do this together."
item.title: 'They want world domination': Australia urged to join 'cold war' on China
